page.title: 04The River Twrch
page.content: The Twrch is a most turbulent stream,(it's name in English means wild boar),during flood carrying a tremendous amount of water in it's steep course from it's water shed around Llyn-y-Fan Fawr on the old Carmarthen Beacons,to it's union with the Tawe at Ystalyfera. Local geologist maintain that the river Twrch,following generally in a North to South direction, has not always followed the course it does today.The Twrch joins the Tawe at Ystalyfera and the sea at Abertawe (Swansea).The change of direction commenced with a cutback from it's "estuary".Today it flows,not over Allt-y-Grug,as it used to but a matter of a mile or so from its' original course.
